intro: Euphrasia cyrenaica, commonly known as the Cyrenaica eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region, particularly found in countries like Egypt, Libya, and parts of the Middle East. It is a low-growing annual herb with thin, hairy stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its flowers typically have five petals and numerous stamens. Euphrasia cyrenaica is part of the Scrophulariaceae family and is known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used to treat eye conditions and other ailments.
